intro: Pelonastes integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leafed pelonastes, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its simple, entire leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often in shades of white or pale pink, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
